meanings.definition: A class of chemical compounds found in plants that have soap-like properties.
meanings.sent1: The saponines in the plant help create a natural soap.
meanings.sent2: When mixed with water, saponines from plants produce a soapy foam.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel thought the saponines in the berries would make a good bubble bath.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like saponines, cleansing the truth from the lies.
meanings.sent5: The children were amazed by the saponines turning water into bubbles like magic.

meanings.definition: Any of various glycosides found in plants that foam when shaken with water.
meanings.sent1: Shaking the plant extract with water released the saponines, creating bubbles.
meanings.sent2: The herbal shampoo contains saponines that make it lather easily.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally added saponines to the soup, causing it to bubble over.
meanings.sent4: His laughter bubbled up like saponines in a washing machine.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to flow with saponines, foaming and frothing as it rushed along.
